title: Building collapses in Punjab's Mohali, several feared trapped - Hindustan Times
summary:
Building collapses in Punjab's Mohali, several feared trapped

Date: Dec 21, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

A multi-storey building in Mohali collapsed, with several people feared trapped under the debris. Emergency services are currently engaged in rescue operations.

  • A multi-storey building collapsed in Mohali, Punjab.
  • District authorities have launched a rescue operation with two excavators and a fire brigade present.
  • A loud noise was reported at the time of the collapse.
  • Causal factors are being investigated, particularly concerning basement excavation nearby.
  • Police and NDRF teams are on-site, and efforts are underway to rescue the trapped individuals.
  • Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann is coordinating with the administration and the rescue teams.
‚ÄúWe pray that there is no loss of life, we will also take action against the culprits.‚Äù - Bhagwant Mann

The incident has raised concerns about safety protocols in construction and ongoing rescue efforts are crucial for those potentially trapped.
newTitle: Building collapses in Punjab's Mohali, several feared trapped

Publication Date: Recent

Source: NDTV

The government has amended election rules to limit public access to certain electronic records, which has raised concerns about transparency in the electoral process.

  • The amendment prevents public inspection of electronic records like CCTV footage and webcasting from polling stations.
  • Officials argue the change is necessary to prevent misuse and protect voter secrecy.
  • Opposition parties claim the amendment erodes the integrity of the electoral process.
  • A court case prompted the amendment, emphasizing the need for clarity regarding what documents are available for public inspection.
  • The amendment only allows access to documents explicitly mentioned in election rules.
‚ÄúIf there was ever a vindication of our assertions regarding the rapidly eroding integrity of the electoral process managed by the Election Commission of India (ECI) in recent times, this is it.‚Äù - Jairam Ramesh

This amendment has sparked considerable debate about the balance between election security and public transparency.

title: "After 'Pushpa 2' Stampede, Actor Said Film Will Be A Hit": Telangana MLA - NDTV
summary:

Publication Date: December 8, 2023 | Source: NDTV

Telangana MLA Akbaruddin Owaisi raised concerns regarding an actor's behavior following a tragic incident at the premiere of 'Pushpa 2', where a woman died during a stampede.

  • A 35-year-old woman died during a stampede at the Sandhya Theatre on December 4.
  • The incident occurred as fans rushed to see actor Allu Arjun at the 'Pushpa 2: The Rule' premiere.
  • Owaisi claimed that the actor commented that the film will now be a hit after the incident.
  • The actor, whose name was not mentioned by Owaisi, was seen waving to fans after the stampede.
  • Police registered a case against the actor, his security team, and theatre management after the incident.
  • The Chief Minister criticized the lack of empathy shown by film personalities towards the victim's family.
‚ÄúSir, I remember once my security official's cap had fallen down while protecting me. He had to do his duty... But here you see, Sir, a woman dies, two small children were caught in the stampede...‚Äù - Akbaruddin Owaisi

The MLA's comments have sparked a debate on celebrity responsibility and crowd management during public events, especially following a tragic incident that resulted in loss of life.

title: People feared trapped after multi-storey building collapses in Punjab‚Äôs Mohali - The Indian Express
summary:
Multi-storey building collapses in Mohali, Army fears 10-15 trapped in basement

Date: Saturday evening, Source: Indian Express

A multi-storey building collapsed in the Sohana area of Mohali, Punjab, raising concerns that several individuals may be trapped beneath the debris.

  • The building collapsed after excavation work for a nearby basement.
  • The Army has sent two engineering columns to assist in rescue efforts.
  • Estimates suggest that 10-15 people could be trapped in the basement.
  • Rescue operations are ongoing, with local police present at the scene.
  • The local former sarpanch reported that a gym was damaged at the time of the collapse.
‚ÄúAs of now, we do not know what has happened. We are looking if anyone is trapped and urge the administration to expedite the rescue work.‚Äù - Parwinder Singh Sohana, former sarpanch

The situation remains critical as the rescue team continues to search for survivors beneath the rubble.

  • The agreement covers human and biomedical research, space experiments, and educational outreach.

title: Breaking : No more benefit shows and ticket rate hikes in Telangana - 123telugu
summary:
No Benefit Shows and Ticket Rate Hikes in Telangana Following Stampede Incident

Published on Dec 21, 2024 by 123Telugu

The Telangana government has decided to halt benefit shows and prevent ticket price increases following a deadly stampede at a movie premiere that caused public outrage and loss of life.

  • The stampede occurred during the Pushpa 2 premiere, resulting in the death of a woman named Revathi and injuring her son.
  • Cinematography Minister Komati Reddy announced the ban on benefit shows and ticket rate hikes.
  • Chief Minister Revanth Reddy emphasized the need to prioritize life over special privileges for the film industry.
  • Actor Allu Arjun was arrested in connection with the incident but quickly gained interim bail from the High Court.
  • The Chief Minister criticized the film industry for their lack of concern for the victims' families.
‚ÄúAfter a life is lost, my government decided not to allow any special privileges to the film industry.‚Äù ‚Äì CM Revanth Reddy

This decisive action from the Telangana government underscores the importance of safety in public events and the government's commitment to protect its citizens.

title: Delhi Excise policy case: Delhi Lieutenant Governor gives nod to ED to prosecute Arvind Kejriwal - The Hindu
summary:
Delhi Lieutenant Governor Approves Prosecution of Arvind Kejriwal in Excise Policy Case

Date: December 21, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Ahead of the upcoming 2025 Delhi Assembly Polls, Delhi Lieutenant Governor V.K. Saxena has sanctioned the Enforcement Directorate to prosecute Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) chief and former Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal in the Delhi excise policy case.

  • The ED sought permission for the prosecution on December 5.
  • Senior AAP leader Atishi criticized the timing and intent behind the prosecution, suggesting it misleads the public.
  • The move follows months of investigations into allegations of corruption related to the excise policy.
  • The Delhi High Court has granted the ED additional time to respond to a petition challenging the trial court's decision regarding the case.
‚ÄúIf LG sir has given permission to prosecute Arvind Kejriwal ji, then what is the problem for ED in making the copy of the approval public? This news is being spread only to mislead people and distract them from the issues.‚Äù ‚Äì Atishi

This decision raises significant political tensions as the Delhi Assembly elections approach, highlighting the ongoing controversy surrounding the excise policy.
newTitle: Delhi Lieutenant Governor Approves Prosecution of Arvind Kejriwal in Excise Policy Case

title: Human infections risk from H5N1 bird flu virus currently low: WHO - DTNEXT
summary:
Human Infections from H5N1 Bird Flu Virus Currently Low, Says WHO

Publication Date: December 2023 | Source: Xinhua News Agency

The World Health Organization (WHO) reports that the global public health risk from H5N1 bird flu viruses is currently low, although some occupationally exposed groups face varying risks.

  • The assessment is based on data highlighting human infections mainly arise from contact with infected animals.
  • As of 2024, 76 human cases have been documented, primarily among farm workers in the US.
  • No significant global public health impact despite a low total number of cases.
  • Animal-to-animal transmission persists, posing variable risks to farm workers based on local conditions.
  • The virus's potential for rapid adaptation raises concerns among experts.
  • Significant economic impacts on global poultry industries threaten food security.
  • The virus has widespread ecological consequences, affecting numerous bird and mammal species.
‚ÄúOngoing animal-to-animal transmission continues to pose a threat.‚Äù - Maria Van Kerkhove, WHO

In conclusion, while the risk to humans remains low, vigilance and collaboration are essential to monitor and mitigate the ongoing threat posed by the H5N1 virus.
newTitle: Human Infections from H5N1 Bird Flu Virus Currently Low, Says WHO
